intro: Cladomyza robustior, commonly known as the robust cliffdwarf, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to dry environments. The plant typically grows in rocky outcrops and coastal cliffs, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are thick and often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Cladomyza robustior is prized for its compact growth habit and ability to survive in harsh, nutrient-poor conditions.
